Title:

Maui Alarm Clock
Artist: Jackie Johnston
Info: My first trip to Maui involved many very loud chickens that lived next door to where I was staying, hence the cheeky title. Despite some lost sleep, the feral chickens on the island always make me happy when I see them. The frame is made from reclaimed wood by an artisan in Waco, Texas, who gets his material from demolished buildings.

This piece was donated to the Maui Hand's fundraiser where 100% of proceeds goes to their displaced artists and the Maui Strong Fund to support disaster relief efforts on Maui.
About: Original
Size: 20 inches x 16 inches
Media: pastel on board
Year: 2020
Location: In a private collection
